poem:
Across the Ocean

Jenny whispers lullabies  
in a land of shifting policies,  
where shadows of home linger,  
like rain-soaked paper lanterns.  
Her daughters, budding in freedom's light,  
are watched by unseen eyes,  
as tides of regulation ripple,  
rocking the cradle of her American dream,  
yet still she hums,  
an unbroken thread in tangled roots.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Fear grows among US’s 390,000 undocumented Chinese immigrants: ‘So many policies have changed’ In 2014, a few years after the birth of her second child, Jenny left China to flee an abusive relationship and government persecution for violating the one-child policy. She brought her younger daughter to San Francisco and, though undocumented, found work at a childcare facility and eventually married a US citizen. Because of extended delays in visa processing, her green card application". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
